js.npmDescription: Elements implementations for kurento media server

remoteClasses.name: DispatcherOneToMany
remoteClasses.doc: A :rom:cls:`Hub` that sends a given source to all the connected sinks

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the dispatcher belongs

constructor.doc: Create a :rom:cls:`DispatcherOneToMany` belonging to the given pipeline.

params.name: source
params.doc: source to be broadcasted

methods.name: setSource
methods.doc: Sets the source port that will be connected to the sinks of every :rom:cls:`HubPort` of the dispatcher

methods.name: removeSource
methods.doc: Remove the source port and stop the media pipeline.

remoteClasses.name: WebRtcEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: WebRtcEndpoint interface. This type of ``Endpoint`` offers media streaming using WebRTC.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the endpoint belongs

params.name: useDataChannels
params.doc: Activate data channels support

properties.name: stunServerAddress
properties.doc: Address of the STUN server (Only IP address are supported)

properties.name: stunServerPort
properties.doc: Port of the STUN server

properties.name: turnUrl
properties.doc:
TURN server URL with this format: 'user:password@address:port(?transport=[udp|tcp|tls])'.
'address' must be an IP (not a domain).
'transport' is optional (UDP by default).

properties.name: ICECandidatePairs
properties.doc: The ICE candidate pair used by the ice library for each stream.

properties.name: IceConnectionState
properties.doc: The ICE connection state for all the connections.

methods.name: gatherCandidates
methods.doc:
Init the gathering of ICE candidates.
It must be called after SdpEndpoint::generateOffer or SdpEndpoint::processOffer

params.name: candidate
params.doc: Remote ICE candidate

params.name: label
params.doc: Channel's label attribute

params.name: ordered
params.doc: If the data channel should guarantee order or not

params.name: maxPacketLifeTime
params.doc: the length of the time window (in milliseconds) during which transmissions and retransmissions may occur in unreliable mode

params.name: maxRetransmits
params.doc: maximum number of retransmissions that are attempted in unreliable mode

params.name: protocol
params.doc: the name of the sub-protocol used

methods.name: createDataChannel
methods.doc: Create a new data channel if data channel are supported

params.name: channelId
params.doc: The channel identifier

remoteClasses.name: HttpPostEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc:
An :rom:cls:`HttpPostEndpoint` contains SINK pads for AUDIO and VIDEO, which provide access to an HTTP file upload function

   This type of endpoint provide unidirectional communications. Its :rom:cls:`MediaSources <MediaSource>` are accessed through the :term:`HTTP` POST method.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the endpoint belongs

params.name: disconnectionTimeout
params.doc: This is the time that an http endpoint will wait for a reconnection, in case an HTTP connection is lost.

params.name: useEncodedMedia
params.doc: configures the endpoint to use encoded media instead of raw media. If the parameter is not set then the element uses raw media. Changing this parameter could affect in a severe way to stability because key frames lost will not be generated. Changing the media type does not affect to the result except in the performance (just in the case where original media and target media are the same) and in the problem with the key frames. We strongly recommended not to use this parameter because correct behaviour is not guarantied.

remoteClasses.name: HttpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Endpoint that enables Kurento to work as an HTTP server, allowing peer HTTP clients to access media.

methods.name: getUrl
methods.doc: Obtains the URL associated to this endpoint

remoteClasses.name: Mixer
remoteClasses.doc: A :rom:cls:`Hub` that allows routing of video between arbitrary port pairs and mixing of audio among several ports

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the Mixer belongs

constructor.doc: Create a :rom:cls:`Mixer` belonging to the given pipeline.

params.name: media
params.doc: The sort of media stream to be connected

params.name: source
params.doc: Source port to be connected

params.name: sink
params.doc: Sink port to be connected

methods.name: connect
methods.doc: Connects each corresponding :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the given source port with the sink port.

params.name: media
params.doc: The sort of media stream to be disconnected

params.name: source
params.doc: Audio source port to be disconnected

params.name: sink
params.doc: Audio sink port to be disconnected

methods.name: disconnect
methods.doc: Disonnects each corresponding :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the given source port from the sink port.

remoteClasses.name: PlayerEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc:
Retrieves content from seekable sources in reliable
mode (does not discard media information) and inject 
them into :term:`KMS`. It
contains one :rom:cls:`MediaSource` for each media type detected.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: The :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` this PlayerEndpoint belongs to.

params.name: uri
params.doc: URI that will be played

params.name: useEncodedMedia
params.doc:
use encoded instead of raw media. If the parameter is false then the
element uses raw media. Changing this parameter can affect stability
severely, as lost key frames lost will not be regenerated. Changing the media type does not
affect to the result except in the performance (just in the case where
original media and target media are the same) and in the problem with the
key frames. We strongly recommended not to use this parameter because
correct behaviour is not guarantied.

properties.name: videoInfo
properties.doc: Returns info about the playing file

properties.name: position
properties.doc: Get or set the actual position of the video in ms. Only for seekable videos

methods.name: play
methods.doc: Starts to send data to the endpoint :rom:cls:`MediaSource`

remoteClasses.name: AlphaBlending
remoteClasses.doc: A :rom:cls:`Hub` that mixes the :rom:attr:`MediaType.AUDIO` stream of its connected sources and constructs one output with :rom:attr:`MediaType.VIDEO` streams of its connected sources into its sink

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the dispatcher belongs

params.name: source
params.doc: The reference to the HubPort setting as master port

params.name: zOrder
params.doc: The order in z to draw the master image

methods.name: setMaster
methods.doc: Sets the source port that will be the master entry to the mixer

params.name: relativeX
params.doc: The x position relative to the master port. Values from 0 to 1 are accepted. The value 0, indicates the coordinate 0 in the master image.

params.name: relativeY
params.doc: The y position relative to the master port. Values from 0 to 1 are accepted. The value 0, indicates the coordinate 0 in the master image.

params.name: zOrder
params.doc: The order in z to draw the images. The greatest value of z is in the top.

params.name: relativeWidth
params.doc: The image width relative to the master port width. Values from 0 to 1 are accepted.

params.name: relativeHeight
params.doc: The image height relative to the master port height. Values from 0 to 1 are accepted.

params.name: port
params.doc: The reference to the confingured port.

methods.name: setPortProperties
methods.doc: Configure the blending mode of one port.

remoteClasses.name: RtpEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Endpoint that provides bidirectional content delivery capabilities with remote networked peers through RTP protocol. An :rom:cls:`RtpEndpoint` contains paired sink and source :rom:cls:`MediaPad` for audio and video.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the endpoint belongs

params.name: crypto
params.doc: Crypto parameters

params.name: useIpv6
params.doc: Use IPv6 instead of IPv4

remoteClasses.name: RecorderEndpoint
remoteClasses.doc: Provides function to store contents in reliable mode (doesn't discard data). It contains :rom:cls:`MediaSink` pads for audio and video.

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the endpoint belongs

params.name: uri
params.doc: URI where the recording will be stored

params.name: mediaProfile
params.doc: Choose either one of the values defined in :rom:attr:`MediaProfileSpecType` as profile for recording

params.name: stopOnEndOfStream
params.doc: Forces the recorder endpoint to finish processing data when an :term:`EOS` is detected in the stream

methods.name: record
methods.doc: Starts storing media received through the :rom:cls:`MediaSink` pad

methods.name: stopAndWait
methods.doc: Stops recording and do not returns until all the content has bee written to the selected uri. This can cause timeouts on some clients if there is too much content to write and/or the transport is slow

remoteClasses.name: Dispatcher
remoteClasses.doc: A :rom:cls:`Hub` that allows routing between arbitrary port pairs

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the dispatcher belongs

constructor.doc: Create a :rom:cls:`Dispatcher` belonging to the given pipeline.

params.name: source
params.doc: Source port to be connected

params.name: sink
params.doc: Sink port to be connected

methods.name: connect
methods.doc: Connects each corresponding :rom:enum:`MediaType` of the given source port with the sink port.

remoteClasses.name: Composite
remoteClasses.doc: A :rom:cls:`Hub` that mixes the :rom:attr:`MediaType.AUDIO` stream of its connected sources and constructs a grid with the :rom:attr:`MediaType.VIDEO` streams of its connected sources into its sink

params.name: mediaPipeline
params.doc: the :rom:cls:`MediaPipeline` to which the dispatcher belongs

properties.name: candidate
properties.doc: The candidate-attribute as defined in section 15.1 of ICE (rfc5245).

properties.name: sdpMid
properties.doc: If present, this contains the identifier of the 'media stream identification'.

properties.name: sdpMLineIndex
properties.doc: The index (starting at zero) of the m-line in the SDP this candidate is associated with.

properties.name: streamID
properties.doc: Stream ID of the ice connection

properties.name: componentID
properties.doc: Component ID of the ice connection

properties.name: localCandidate
properties.doc: The local candidate used by the ice library.

properties.name: remoteCandidate
properties.doc: The remote candidate used by the ice library.

complexTypes.name: IceCandidatePair
complexTypes.doc: The ICE candidate pair used by the ice library.

properties.name: streamId
properties.doc: The ID of the stream

properties.name: componentId
properties.doc: The ID of the component

properties.name: state
properties.doc: The state of the component

complexTypes.name: IceConnection
complexTypes.doc: The ICE connection state for a certain stream and component.

properties.name: isSeekable
properties.doc: Seek is possible in video source

properties.name: seekableInit
properties.doc: First video position to do seek in ms

properties.name: seekableEnd
properties.doc: Last video position to do seek in ms

properties.name: duration
properties.doc: Video duration in ms

complexTypes.name: MediaProfileSpecType
complexTypes.doc:
Media Profile.

Currently WEBM and MP4 are supported.

complexTypes.name: CryptoSuite
complexTypes.doc: Describes the encryption and authentication algorithms

properties.name: key
properties.doc: The cryptographic master key. It should be 30 bytes length when AES_128_CM cipher is used or 46 bytes length for AES_256_CM cipher), If no key is provided a random one will be used

properties.name: crypto
properties.doc: The crypto-suite used

properties.name: candidate
properties.doc: New gathered local candidate

events.name: OnIceCandidate
events.doc: Notify of a new gathered local candidate.

events.name: OnIceGatheringDone
events.doc: Notify that all candidates have been gathered.

properties.name: streamId
properties.doc: The ID of the stream

properties.name: componentId
properties.doc: The ID of the component

properties.name: state
properties.doc: The state of the component

events.name: OnIceComponentStateChanged
events.doc: Notify about the change of an ICE component state.

properties.name: channelId
properties.doc: The channel identifier

events.name: OnDataChannelOpened
events.doc: Notify the creation of a new data channel.

properties.name: channelId
properties.doc: The channel identifier

events.name: OnDataChannelClosed
events.doc: Notify the destruction of a data channel.

properties.name: candidatePair
properties.doc: The new pair of candidates

events.name: NewCandidatePairSelected
events.doc: Notify of the new pair of ICE candidates used by the ice library.

properties.name: mediaType
properties.doc: The media stream

events.name: OnKeySoftLimit
events.doc: Emitted when encryption is used and any stream reached the soft key usage limit and will expire soon.

events.name: EndOfStream
events.doc: Event raised when the stream that the element sends out is finished.

events.name: Recording
events.doc: Raised when the recoding effectively starts. ie: Media is received by the recorder once record method has been called.

events.name: Paused
events.doc: Raised when the recorder goes to pause state

events.name: Stopped
events.doc: Raised when the recorder has been stopped and all the media has been written to storage.
